pageProps.title: Components
pageProps.description: Discover all the Agriculture Design System components here including visual examples, component props, and live code examples.

pkgList.title: A11y
pkgList.description: Utilities for improving accessibility.

pkgList.title: AG Branding
pkgList.description: A colour palette and logo set for Agriculture

pkgList.title: Accordion
pkgList.description: An accordion shows or hides sections of content. It lets users see only the content they need.

pkgList.title: Autocomplete
pkgList.description: Autocompletes allow users to search through a set of options fetched over the network based on their input

pkgList.title: Badge
pkgList.description: Badges are decorative indicators used to either call attention to an item or for communicating non-actionable, supplemental information.

pkgList.title: Box
pkgList.description: A set of primitive layout components

pkgList.title: Breadcrumbs
pkgList.description: Breadcrumbs are a navigational aid that display a user's location on a website as a row of links, usually located at the top of the page.

pkgList.title: Button
pkgList.description: Buttons trigger actions and can communicate the hierarchy of interactions a user can choose.

pkgList.title: Call To Action
pkgList.description: Call to action links are visually distinct instructions to users designed to provoke an immediate response using verbs such as 'call now' or 'find out more'.

pkgList.title: Callout
pkgList.description: Callouts are an excerpt of text or an article that has been pulled out and used as a visual clue to draw the eye to the text. They are used to help direct a user's attention to important pieces of information.

pkgList.title: Card
pkgList.description: The card component is used to provide a brief summary of content or a task, often with a link to more detail. Cards are frequently displayed alongside other cards to group related content or tasks.

pkgList.title: Columns
pkgList.description: A grid consists of a framework of cells laid out and aligned vertically and horizontally. It helps users read and visually navigate website content more easily, using a responsive, scrollable column structure.

pkgList.title: Combobox
pkgList.description: Allows the user to browse, search, and make a single selection from a large list of values.

pkgList.title: Content
pkgList.description: A collection of simple layout containers to wrap content.

pkgList.title: Control Input
pkgList.description: Control inputs help users input one or more selections from multiple options. Our control inputs consist of checkboxes and radio buttons.

pkgList.title: Core
pkgList.description: Core includes a range of styles, variables and code that form the foundation of how the Design System works, including colour, typography and spacing.

pkgList.title: Date Picker
pkgList.description: Allow users to select a single date or a range of dates.

pkgList.title: Details
pkgList.description: A disclosure widget for supplimental information that explains a component, section or flow.

pkgList.title: Direction Link
pkgList.description: Direction links are accompanied by arrows to help users move quickly to other parts of the page or through a process.

pkgList.title: Field
pkgList.description: The field package exposes the elements around form inputs, and an API to compose them.

pkgList.title: Fieldset
pkgList.description: Use the fieldset component to group related form inputs.

pkgList.title: File Upload
pkgList.description: Allows a user to select files for upload, via drag-and-drop or using the system file browser.

pkgList.title: Footer
pkgList.description: Footers help users find what they need after scrolling to the bottom of a page. They provide supplementary information such as copyright, ABN details, contact information, links to other pages within the website, and email and social media links.

pkgList.title: Form Stack
pkgList.description: Use to FormStack component to apply consistent spacing between form elements.

pkgList.title: Global Alert
pkgList.description: Global Alerts show pressing and high-signal messages, such as system alerts.

pkgList.title: Header
pkgList.description: The masthead of our applications, Header incorporates our AWE brand, and provides a user context on where they are.

pkgList.title: Heading
pkgList.description: A primitive typographic component for constrained heading styles. Headings help to structure content on a page using relative visual prominence.

pkgList.title: Hero Banner
pkgList.description: Hero banner are used to grab a userâ€™s attention.

pkgList.title: Icon
pkgList.description: The Agriculture Design System supports the use of universal system icons. The icon component is used to apply our set of universal icons to more complex components of the system.

pkgList.title: Inpage Nav
pkgList.description: Inpage nav links helps users scan the contents of a page and navigate to different sections of the page.

pkgList.title: Link List
pkgList.description: The link list style is a simple list of vertical or horizontal links used for site navigation. It is used to order information for users.

pkgList.title: Loading
pkgList.description: Loading indicators inform users that their action is being processed.

pkgList.title: Main Nav
pkgList.description: A horizontal list of links to key areas on the website. Typically placed in the header.

pkgList.title: Modal
pkgList.description: Modal is a window that appears in front of the current page, to focus user attention on one action or piece of information

pkgList.title: Page Alert
pkgList.description: Page alerts are used to notify users of important information or changes on a page, in a way that attracts the user's attention without interrupting the current task.

pkgList.title: Pagination
pkgList.description: Pagination allows large amounts of content to be separated into multiple pages.

pkgList.title: Progress Indicator
pkgList.description: Progress indicators provide visual feedback to users to let them know and understand their current context at any given time and be assured that they are progressing through the system.

pkgList.title: Prose
pkgList.description: Provides typographic defaults for vanilla HTML.

pkgList.title: Search Box
pkgList.description: An input that allows users to enter a keyword to search content on a website.

pkgList.title: Search Input
pkgList.description: Search enables users to specify a word or a phrase to find relevant pieces of content.

pkgList.title: Select
pkgList.description: Select provides a means to select a single item from a collapsible list. Use of select helps to reduce input errors and screen space. It's commonly used to help users enter a value into a form field.

pkgList.title: Side Nav
pkgList.description: A vertical list of links for site navigation typically placed next to the body content.

pkgList.title: Skeleton
pkgList.description: Skeletons are visual placeholders for information while data is still loading.

pkgList.title: Skip Link
pkgList.description: Skip links are internal page links that aid navigation around a page. They are detected by screen readers and help users quickly jump to and over content on the page.

pkgList.title: Sub Nav
pkgList.description: A horizontal list of links typically placed between the main navigation and page content.

pkgList.title: Summary List
pkgList.description: Use the summary list to summarise information, for example, a userâ€™s responses at the end of a form.

pkgList.title: Switch
pkgList.description: Allows a user to toggle a setting on or off, immediately affecting the user interface.

pkgList.title: Table
pkgList.description: Used to display tabular data.

pkgList.title: Tags
pkgList.description: Tags are a means of classifying content, typically using keywords or labels. They are added to a web page, an asset or other content to help users search for and find related content quickly and easily.

pkgList.title: Text
pkgList.description: A primitive typographic component for constrained text styles

pkgList.title: Text Input
pkgList.description: Text inputs are input fields typically used in forms that allow the user to enter text data in a structured format.

pkgList.title: Text Link
pkgList.description: A typographic component for creating a hyperlinks.

pkgList.title: Textarea
pkgList.description: Textarea is a long form text input and can be scaled up or down in size by the user.
